result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas W. Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Douglas W. Kratz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer has been provided and in speaking with the defendant today; there is resolution.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant agrees.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a 
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.


BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
  DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing in October

Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Return date on August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas W. Kratz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant did not qualify for PD appointment and so he would like to waive his right to an Attorney to speak with the DA.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant appeared on warrant; warrant satisfied and quashed.
Return date on July 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Douglas W. Kratz
Current: W3724 County Rd. C, Lot 21, Montello, WI 53949   (Effective: 05-26-2016)
Prior: 260 E. Montello St., Montello, WI 53949

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:   Set for Return

Defendant Douglas W. Kratz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant appeared in court; warrant satisfied.  
Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant gave new address.  Defendant states that he did not receive any paperwork.  Atty Hendee states that a bond was signed with the court date on there.

Atty Hendee asks that the court reinstate the cash bond.

BY THE COURT: Reinstate the $100 cash bond with same conditions.  Return date scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas W. Kratz not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; cash bond to be revoked.
